Apply a [DRAG_COEFFICIENT] to simulate water resistance when an object moves below the [WATER_LEVEL]. Discuss using a custom useFrame loop to apply these forces manually to Rapier bodies.
column11: A component wrapper that applies Archimedes' principle forces to any child RigidBody based on its Y-position.

column2: Procedural Level Generation with Physics Constraints
column10: Develop a system for procedurally generating 3D levels where physics dictates the final layout. Use a [GENERATION_SEED] to spawn components and let them 'settle' using physics to find stable positions. Implement [SPACING_ALGORITHM] to prevent initial overlaps and use [BENDING_CONSTRAINTS] for procedural bridges or ropes that connect generated platforms in R3F.
column11: A logic flow where objects are spawned in the air and the 'final' level state is captured after physics simulation stabilizes.

column2: Custom Shader Deformation via Physics Contact Data
column10: Create a bridge between physics collisions and GLSL shaders in R3F. Extract contact point data from Rapier and pass it as a [GLSL_UNIFORM_NAME] to a custom shader material. Use this data to create a [DEFORMATION_RADIUS] effect, such as ripples or dents, on the mesh surface. Explain how to manage a [CONTACT_BUFFER_SIZE] to handle multiple simultaneous impacts efficiently.
column11: A React Three Fiber setup using a data texture to pass collision coordinates into a vertex shader for real-time mesh displacement.

column2: Implementing a 2D-in-3D Physics Game Engine
column10: Guide a developer through building a 2D platformer physics system within a 3D React Three Fiber environment. Detail how to [LOCK_AXIS] (e.g., Z-axis) on all RigidBodies to ensure movement stays planar. Adjust [PLANAR_FRICTION] for snappy controls and explain how to configure the camera with [ORTHO_ZOOM] to maintain the 2D aesthetic while utilizing 3D lighting and shadows.
column11: A Rapier configuration setting 'enabledTranslations' and 'enabledRotations' to restrict physics to a 2D plane.

column2: Advanced Raycasting for Weapon Systems and Interaction
column10: Master Raycasting within the R3F physics world. Explain how to perform raycasts that respect [COLLISION_GROUPS] to filter out specific layers. Implement [PENETRATION_LOGIC] to detect multiple hits along a single [RAY_DISTANCE]. Discuss the performance differences between using the Three.js Raycaster and the physics engine's native raycast methods for fast-moving projectiles.
column11: A highly optimized 'Weapon' hook that performs a Rapier raycast on the physics tick to determine hits instantly.

column2: Global Wind and Turbulence Force Fields
column10: Implement a global force field system in R3F. Create a 'WindManager' that applies a continuous force defined by [WIND_STRENGTH] and a [NOISE_FUNCTION] (like Perlin noise) to mimic turbulence. Use a filtering system to apply these forces only to RigidBodies with specific [AFFECTED_TAGS], such as foliage or particles, while ignoring heavy static objects.
column11: A global useFrame loop that iterates through a RefSet of RigidBodies to apply localized noise-based external forces.

column2: Deterministic Physics for Replay and Undo Systems
column10: Architect a deterministic physics simulation in React Three Fiber to support game replays. Force the physics engine to use a strictly [FIXED_TIMESTEP] and eliminate any frame-rate-dependent logic. Detail how to save [STATE_SNAPSHOT_INTERVAL] snapshots of all RigidBody transforms and how a [PRNG_SEED] ensures that procedural elements remain consistent across different sessions.
column11: A blueprint for a 'Time Machine' component that can rewind and replay physics states by storing body properties in an array.

column2: Visualizing Physics Debuggers in Production-Ready Code
column10: Explain the best practices for implementing a physics debugger in a production R3F app. Create a toggleable [DEBUG_HUD_UI] that overlays the physics wireframes using @react-three/rapier's <Debug /> component. Discuss how to customize the [WIREFRAME_OPACITY] and [COLLIDER_COLOR_MAP] to differentiate between static, dynamic, and kinematic bodies for faster troubleshooting.
column11: A wrapper component that conditionally renders the Debug component based on URL parameters or a keyboard shortcut.

column2: Particle-Based Physics for Liquid and Sand Simulations
column10: Explore particle-based physics simulations within R3F. Using a physics library like Ammo.js (PBD) or a custom GPU approach, define a simulation for [MAX_PARTICLE_COUNT] particles. Set the [PARTICLE_RADIUS] for collision detection and adjust [VISCOSITY] to simulate materials ranging from water to thick sand. Explain how to render these particles efficiently using instancing or points.
column11: A technical guide for implementing Position Based Dynamics (PBD) to create a realistic sand-falling or fluid-pouring effect.

column2: Advanced Zustand Cart Logic for Multi-Currency E-commerce
column10: Act as a Senior Frontend Architect. Design a Zustand store for a global e-commerce platform that manages a complex shopping cart. The state must handle [CURRENCY_MAP] for dynamic price conversion, integrate [TAX_CALCULATION_LOGIC] based on user location, and initialize with [INITIAL_CART_STATE]. Implement robust actions for adding/removing items with optimistic updates, calculating sub-totals, and handling coupon applications. Use TypeScript and ensure the store follows the slice pattern for scalability.
column11: A production-grade TypeScript Zustand store featuring localized price formatting, automated tax re-calculation hooks, and optimized selector functions for cart badge updates.

column2: Implementing Zustand Slice Pattern for Scalable E-commerce Architecture
column10: You are a Technical Lead. Develop a modular state management architecture using Zustand's slice pattern. Create individual slices for [FEATURE_SLICES] and combine them into a single [ROOT_STORE_NAME]. Demonstrate how to manage cross-slice dependencies without creating circular references. Include a strategy for testing these slices using [DEPENDENCY_INJECTION_MOCKS]. Focus on clean code principles and state isolation.
column11: A clean, maintainable directory structure and implementation of a root store that merges separate 'User', 'Cart', and 'Product' slices into a unified state accessible across the app.

column2: Optimizing Zustand Persistence with Custom Storage and Rehydration
column10: As a Performance Engineer, configure Zustand's persist middleware for a high-traffic e-commerce app. Use [STORAGE_ENGINE] (e.g., IndexedDB or encrypted LocalStorage) for data retention. Implement a 'partialize' function to only persist [PARTIALIZE_KEYS] to keep the storage footprint small. Crucially, define a [VERSION_MIGRATION_STRATEGY] to handle state schema changes between app deployments without breaking the user's session.
column11: A customized persistence configuration that securely stores user preferences while handling seamless schema updates during the rehydration phase.

column2: Zustand Performance Optimization using Shallow Selectors and Atomic Updates
column10: You are a Web Performance Specialist. Analyze an e-commerce dashboard with a component tree depth of [COMPONENT_TREE_DEPTH]. Provide a Zustand implementation strategy that prevents unnecessary re-renders when [FREQUENT_UPDATE_KEYS] change. Use shallow equality checks and atomic selectors to target [SELECTIVE_RENDERING_TARGETS]. Show the difference between standard hooks and optimized selector usage for massive lists of product data.
column11: A set of optimized React components utilizing 'useStore(selector, shallow)' to achieve 60fps performance during rapid state updates like live auction bidding.

column2: Seamless SSR Hydration with Zustand and Next.js for E-commerce
column10: Expert Prompt: Design a hydration bridge between a Next.js server-side rendered [PAGE_TYPE] and a client-side Zustand store. The store must accept [INITIAL_STATE_PROPS] from the server and merge them seamlessly upon mount. Create a custom [HYDRATION_HOOK_NAME] that ensures no 'checksum mismatch' errors occur. Address the challenge of keeping the UI consistent while the client-side store takes over.
column11: A robust Next.js integration pattern that prevents hydration flickers by synchronizing server-generated product metadata with the client-side Zustand state.

column2: Synchronizing Zustand State with React Query for Real-time Inventory
column10: Act as a Full-Stack Engineer. Create a hybrid state management system where TanStack Query handles server state and Zustand handles local UI state. For an e-commerce inventory system, map [QUERY_KEY_MAPPING] to Zustand updates. Implement [MUTATION_EFFECTS] that update the local Zustand store immediately (optimistic UI) and then synchronize with the server. Define a [STALE_TIME_THRESHOLD] for triggering background refreshes.
column11: A synchronized system where product stock levels stay updated in real-time across the UI, using React Query for fetching and Zustand for local state manipulation.

column2: Custom Zustand Middleware for Advanced E-commerce Logging and Debugging
column10: Build a custom Zustand middleware for an enterprise e-commerce platform. The middleware must log all state transitions at [LOG_LEVEL], but automatically redact [SENSITIVE_KEYS] (like credit card numbers or PII). Furthermore, it should batch and send significant state changes to [ANALYTICS_ENDPOINT] for user behavior tracking. Ensure the middleware is lightweight and doesn't introduce latency to the main thread.
column11: A high-performance middleware utility that provides developers with clean Redux-style logs while maintaining privacy and reporting business-critical events to analytics.

column2: Managing Complex Multi-Step Checkout Workflows with Zustand
column10: You are a UX Engineer. Map out a state machine within Zustand to handle a multi-step checkout: [CHECKOUT_STEPS]. Each step must satisfy a [VALIDATION_LOGIC_SCHEMA] before the user can proceed. Manage [BACK_BUTTON_BEHAVIOR] to ensure data is preserved but sensitive fields are cleared appropriately. Implement a 'draft' save feature that allows users to return to their checkout progress later.
column11: A robust state machine implementation ensuring users can only navigate to valid checkout steps while automatically saving progress to local storage.

column2: Deeply Nested State Management in Zustand using Immer Middleware
column10: Act as a Senior React Developer. Implement the Immer middleware for a Zustand store managing a [NESTED_PRODUCT_OBJECT] with high complexity (e.g., variant options, custom attributes, nested reviews). Show how to perform updates on [UPDATE_PATH_EXAMPLE] using mutable-style logic while maintaining strict [IMMUTABILITY_REQUIREMENTS]. Compare the readability of the Immer-based approach versus standard spread operators.
column11: A clean state update logic that handles deeply nested modifications to product variants without the boilerplate of recursive object spreading.

column2: Secure Authentication and Role-Based Access Control via Zustand
column10: Design a secure authentication slice for an e-commerce admin panel. Define [USER_ROLES] and store them in Zustand. Implement a [TOKEN_REFRESH_STRATEGY] that interacts with an Axios interceptor. Add an [AUTO_LOGOUT_TIMER] that clears the Zustand state and redirects to login after inactivity. Ensure that the 'auth' state is isolated and cannot be tampered with through the browser console easily.
column11: An integrated Auth store that handles JWT rotation, role-based navigation guards, and secure state clearing upon session expiration.

column2: Scalable Product Filtering and Search Persistence using Zustand
column10: As a Technical SEO, develop a Zustand store for product search and filtering. The [FILTER_SCHEMA] should include categories, price ranges, and ratings. Implement [URL_QUERY_SYNC] to ensure that every filter change updates the browser URL, making the search results shareable. Add a [DEBOUNCE_TIME] to the search action to optimize API calls. Focus on the 'history' API integration to support browser back/forward buttons.
column11: A dynamic filtering system that keeps the UI in sync with URL parameters, providing an SEO-friendly and shareable search experience.

column2: Implementing Undo-Redo Functionality for Product Configuration in Zustand
column10: Create a 'zundo' or custom implementation for undo-redo functionality in a product customizer. The [CONFIG_STATE_SHAPE] includes colors, textures, and dimensions. Maintain a [HISTORY_LIMIT] for memory efficiency and ensure [EXCLUDED_ACTIONS] (like 'previewing') do not pollute the undo stack. Provide a clear API for the UI to display 'Undo' and 'Redo' buttons dynamically based on the current stack state.
column11: A sophisticated state history manager allowing users to revert changes in a product builder while maintaining high application performance.

column2: Unit Testing Zustand Stores in E-commerce Apps using Vitest
column10: You are a QA Engineer. Write a comprehensive test suite using Vitest for a Zustand store action: [ACTION_NAME]. Define the [EXPECTED_STATE_CHANGE] and explain how to mock [MOCK_SERVICES] like external APIs or browser storage. Show how to reset the store between tests to prevent state leakage and ensure isolation. Include tests for edge cases like network failures during state transitions.
column11: A robust Vitest configuration and test file that guarantees state integrity across complex business logic transitions in the e-commerce store.

column2: Managing User Personalization and Dynamic Theme Switching in Zustand
column10: Build a Zustand store for 'User Preferences' in a luxury e-commerce app. The store should manage [USER_PREFS_MODEL] (e.g., layout mode, language, font size) and a [THEME_COLORS_SCHEMA]. Implement [DEVICE_SYNC_LOGIC] where changes are saved to the backend but instantly reflected in the UI. Demonstrate how to wrap your application in a theme provider that listens to this Zustand state.
column11: A personalization engine that updates the app's look and feel instantly based on stored user settings, with cross-device synchronization.

column2: Global Error Boundary and Notification State Management with Zustand
column10: Develop a centralized 'Toast' and 'Error' management system using Zustand. Define [NOTIFICATION_TYPES] (e.g., Success, Warning, Fatal Error). Create an action that triggers a notification with an [AUTO_HIDE_DURATION]. For fatal errors, implement [ERROR_RECOVERY_ACTIONS] that allow the user to retry the failed operation from the notification. Ensure the state can handle multiple concurrent notifications in a queue.
column11: A non-intrusive notification queue that provides users with actionable feedback and recovery options during e-commerce transaction failures.

column2: Versioned State Migrations for E-commerce Persistence in Zustand
column10: As a Systems Architect, solve the problem of breaking changes in persisted Zustand state. When [OLD_SCHEMA_KEYS] are replaced by [NEW_SCHEMA_KEYS], write a migration function using [MIGRATION_TRANSFORM_LOGIC]. Demonstrate how to use the 'version' property in Zustand's persist middleware to trigger this transformation only when necessary, ensuring zero data loss for existing customers.
column11: A foolproof migration script that upgrades legacy cart data to a new format, preventing application crashes after major version updates.

column2: Cross-App State Communication in Micro-frontends using Zustand
column10: You are a Micro-frontend Specialist. Implement a strategy for sharing a Zustand store between a [HOST_APP_ID] and various remote e-commerce modules. Use a [REMOTE_STORE_NAMESPACE] to avoid naming collisions. Show how to utilize a [SHARED_EVENT_BUS] or window-level store sharing to allow the 'Checkout' app to read the 'Product' app's cart state without tight coupling.
column11: A decoupled state-sharing architecture for micro-frontends that allows independent teams to contribute to a unified e-commerce experience.

column2: Product Comparison Logic and List Persistency using Zustand
column10: Design a 'Product Comparison' feature using Zustand. Limit the comparison list to [MAX_COMPARISON_ITEMS]. The state should track [COMPARABLE_ATTRIBUTES] for each item. Implement [UI_RESTRICTION_LOGIC] that prevents adding duplicate products or exceeding the limit. Ensure the list persists across sessions so users can research products over multiple days.
column11: A highly efficient product comparison engine with persistent storage and built-in validation to manage user selection limits.

column2: Automated E-commerce Analytics Event Tracking with Zustand Middleware
column10: Create a Zustand middleware that automatically triggers [ANALYTICS_SDK] (e.g., Google Analytics or Segment) calls. Filter for specific actions in the [TRACKED_ACTIONS_LIST] (like 'ADD_TO_CART'). Map the Zustand state change to a [PAYLOAD_MAPPING] required by the analytics provider. This should be transparent to the UI developers and handled entirely at the state layer.
column11: An automated tracking layer that ensures every business-critical action is logged for marketing analysis with zero additional UI code.

column2: High-Performance Wishlist Management with Optimistic Updates in Zustand
column10: Act as a Senior UX Developer. Implement a 'Wishlist' store in Zustand that uses optimistic updates for a snappy user experience. When a user adds a [PRODUCT_MODEL_TYPE], update the UI instantly. Attempt to sync with the server after [SYNC_DELAY_MS]. If the server request fails, implement [ERROR_ROLLBACK_LOGIC] to revert the state and notify the user. Focus on achieving a zero-latency perception.
column11: A responsive wishlist system that prioritizes user perceived speed while maintaining data consistency through clever error-rollback mechanisms.

column2: Mastering Advanced Tailwind CSS Bento Grid Layouts
column10: Act as a Senior Frontend Developer. Design a sophisticated 'Bento Box' style grid layout using Tailwind CSS. The grid should accommodate [ITEM_COUNT] items, transitioning from [MOBILE_COLS] columns on mobile to [DESKTOP_COLS] columns on large screens. Use Tailwind's grid-rows and grid-cols utilities along with 'col-span' and 'row-span' to create an asymmetrical, visually balanced layout. Incorporate a [GAP_SPACING] gap and ensure each grid cell contains a placeholder card with hover effects and responsive padding.
column11: The system generates a 12-column desktop grid where the first item spans 'md:col-span-8 md:row-span-2' for high visual impact, while smaller items fill the surrounding gaps.

column2: Implementing Fluid Typography with Tailwind CSS Clamp Functions
column10: Develop a comprehensive Tailwind CSS typography configuration that utilizes CSS clamp() for fluid scaling. Define a utility class or extend the theme in 'tailwind.config.js' where the font size scales smoothly from [MIN_FONT_SIZE] at a viewport of [MIN_VIEWPORT] to [MAX_FONT_SIZE] at [MAX_VIEWPORT]. Provide the exact mathematical formula for the preferred value in the clamp function and demonstrate how to apply it to H1 through H6 elements in a semantic HTML structure.
column11: The configuration produces a 'text-fluid-h1' class that calculates a dynamic clamp value, ensuring headlines look perfectly proportioned on both mobile devices and wide monitors.

column2: Designing Asymmetric Magazine Layouts with Tailwind Grid
column10: Create a high-end editorial magazine layout using Tailwind CSS Grid. Focus on an asymmetric aesthetic for a [SECTION_THEME] section. Use overlapping grid items, negative margins, and the 'z-index' utility to create depth. Ensure images maintain a [IMAGE_RATIO] aspect ratio and text blocks follow [CONTENT_ALIGNMENT] rules. The layout must remain readable and functional, collapsing into a single-column stack on mobile devices.
column11: The prompt outputs a sophisticated grid structure where text blocks overlap hero images by 10% of the grid width, utilizing Tailwind's 'z-10' and '-ml-12' utilities for a modern look.

column2: Tailwind CSS Modular Scale Typography Configuration
column10: As a design systems architect, generate a 'tailwind.config.js' snippet that establishes a typography system based on a modular scale. Use a base font size of [BASE_SIZE] and a mathematical ratio of [RATIO] (e.g., 1.250 for Major Third). Map these values to Tailwind's font-size scale (sm, base, lg, xl, 2xl, etc.). Ensure that the line-height for each step is adjusted according to a [LINE_HEIGHT_RATIO] to maintain vertical rhythm.
column11: This results in a perfectly harmonized font scale where each size is exactly 1.250x larger than the previous, creating a consistent visual hierarchy across the entire UI.

column2: Advanced CSS Subgrid Patterns in Tailwind CSS
column10: Demonstrate the use of CSS Subgrid within a Tailwind CSS framework to align nested components to a global grid. Create a parent container with [PARENT_GRID_COLS] columns. Inside, define a card component that spans [SUBGRID_SPAN] columns and uses 'grid-template-columns: subgrid' to align its internal elements (header, content, footer) to the parent's tracks. Apply [ALIGNMENT] utilities to ensure consistent spacing and justify-content logic across multiple nested cards.
column11: The output provides a robust structure where nested headers in different cards align perfectly on the same vertical axis, regardless of content length, using 'grid-cols-subgrid'.

column2: Vertical Rhythm and Baseline Grid with Tailwind Spacing
column10: Engineer a vertical rhythm system for a content-heavy website using Tailwind CSS. Set the baseline unit to [BASELINE_UNIT]. Adjust the 'leading' (line-height) and 'margin' utilities so that all text elements, including [FONT_FAMILY] paragraphs and headers, align to this baseline. Define a custom spacing scale in the Tailwind config that enforces multiples of [BASELINE_UNIT] for [PARAGRAPH_SPACING] to ensure perfectly consistent vertical gaps.
column11: The code creates a disciplined layout where every line of text sits on a 4px baseline grid, achieved by extending Tailwind's spacing and leading configurations.

column2: Fluid Layouts with Golden Ratio Grid Proportioning
column10: Construct a responsive Tailwind CSS layout based on the Golden Ratio (1.618). Create a container with a max-width of [CONTAINER_WIDTH]. Divide the grid into a primary content area and a sidebar using the ratio [PRIMARY_COL_WEIGHT]:[SECONDARY_COL_WEIGHT]. Use Tailwind's fraction-based widths (e.g., w-2/3) or arbitrary grid-template-columns (e.g., grid-cols-[1.618fr_1fr]). Ensure the layout is fluid and adjust the ratio for tablet viewports.
column11: This prompt generates a visually pleasing 62/38 split for content and sidebar, utilizing Tailwind's JIT engine to apply precise fractional grid tracks.

column2: Dynamic Grid Overlays for Hero Sections
column10: Design a complex hero section using Tailwind CSS Grid that features a background image grid overlay. Create a [GRID_DENSITY] grid (e.g., 12x12) that covers the hero area. Place high-resolution image fragments or decorative elements in specific cells using grid-area coordinates. Overlay a text heading at [TEXT_POSITION] with a background blur effect and [OVERLAY_OPACITY] opacity. Ensure the grid remains responsive and the text remains the focal point.
column11: The resulting component uses 'grid-rows-12' and 'grid-cols-12' to precisely position a floating glassmorphism text box over a multi-cell image collage.

column2: Responsive Aspect Ratio Grid Cards with Tailwind
column10: Build a responsive media gallery using Tailwind CSS. Each card must strictly maintain a [ASPECT_RATIO] aspect ratio regardless of the grid cell size. Configure the grid to use [GRID_FLOW] (e.g., dense flow) to minimize empty spaces. Apply [HOVER_ANIMATION] utilities to the cards. The grid should automatically adjust the number of columns based on the viewport width without using explicit media query classes where possible (use minmax).
column11: The solution implements 'aspect-video' or 'aspect-square' on grid items within a 'grid-cols-[repeat(auto-fill,minmax(250px,1fr))]' container for a fluid, zero-breakpoint gallery.

column2: Fluid Typography System for Dark Mode Contrast
column10: Create a Tailwind CSS typography system that dynamically adjusts for dark mode to improve readability. Implement a fluid scale up to [FLUID_SCALE_MAX]. Use Tailwind's 'dark:' variant to switch font-weight from [LIGHT_WEIGHT] in light mode to [DARK_WEIGHT] in dark mode to compensate for the visual 'glow' effect of light text on dark backgrounds. Include fluid line-height adjustments to maintain legibility at all scales.
column11: The prompt generates a system where headings use 'text-4xl sm:text-fluid-xl' and switch from 'font-semibold' to 'font-medium' when dark mode is active.

column2: Variable Font Integration with Tailwind Fluid Utilities
column10: Configure Tailwind CSS to support a fluid variable font system using [FONT_NAME]. Define a custom utility class that maps viewport width to the font's 'wght' (weight) and 'wdth' (width) axes within the range [AXIS_RANGE]. Ensure the [DEFAULT_WEIGHT] is used as a fallback. Provide the CSS @font-face declaration and the Tailwind configuration necessary to trigger these fluid transitions as the window resizes.
column11: The configuration allows for 'font-variable' classes that smoothly transition font-weight from 300 to 800 as the user scales the browser window.

column2: Complex Data Visualization Grid with Tailwind
column10: Generate a highly functional data-table using Tailwind CSS Grid. The table should support [DATA_COLUMNS] columns with specific widths (e.g., fixed, fluid, and 'min-content'). Implement [ROW_STRIPING_COLOR] for zebra-striping. Use Tailwind's 'group-hover' utilities to highlight entire rows or specific data cells based on [HIGHLIGHT_LOGIC]. Ensure the header remains 'sticky' and the grid handles horizontal overflowing gracefully on small screens.
column11: The grid uses 'grid-cols-[200px_1fr_120px]' to maintain a fixed ID column while allowing the primary data field to expand and contract dynamically.

column2: Hierarchical Nested Layouts with Tailwind Grid
column10: Design a dashboard layout with [DEPTH_LEVELS] levels of nested Tailwind grids. The outermost grid should define the main sidebar and content area with an [OUTER_GAP]. The inner content area must contain a secondary grid for widgets with an [INNER_GAP]. Demonstrate how to manage 'z-index' and 'overflow' properties across nested layers to prevent layout shifts and ensure that dropdowns or tooltips within the deepest level are not clipped.
column11: The architecture provides a triple-nested grid system where widget components inside the main dashboard panel maintain their own internal 4-column responsive layouts.

column2: Tailwind CSS Container Queries for Modular Grid Items
column10: Leverage the '@tailwindcss/container-queries' plugin to create a modular [COMPONENT_TYPE]. Define a grid layout for the component that changes its internal structure based on the width of its parent container rather than the viewport. Set [BREAKPOINT_WIDTHS] for the container 'md' and 'lg' equivalents. Show how the grid tracks (grid-cols) and typography sizes adjust automatically when the component is placed in a narrow sidebar versus a wide main content area.
column11: The code defines a 'card' that switches from a vertical stack to a horizontal grid layout as soon as its container exceeds '@container-md' (448px).

column2: Fluid Typography with Multi-Step Modular Scale
column10: Create a Tailwind CSS typography plugin or config that generates [STEPS_COUNT] font-size steps. The system must use a [MOBILE_RATIO] for smaller viewports and transition to a [DESKTOP_RATIO] for larger screens. Use CSS variables and calc() within Tailwind's arbitrary values to ensure that every font size (e.g., text-step-1, text-step-2) scales fluidly and maintains the modular ratio relative to each other at any viewport width.
column11: This system provides a 'text-step-3' utility that is perfectly sized for subheadings, scaling from 1.5rem on mobile to 2.25rem on desktop using a calculated fluid bridge.

column2: Masonry-Style Column Layouts using Tailwind Utilities
column10: Implement a Masonry-style layout using Tailwind's 'columns' utilities. Set the layout to [COLUMN_COUNT] columns with a [COLUMN_GAP] spacing. Ensure that the grid items do not break across columns by applying the appropriate [BREAK_INSIDE] utilities (e.g., break-inside-avoid). Show how to integrate fluid typography within these columns so that headings and body text scale appropriately as the column width changes.
column11: The output utilizes 'columns-3 gap-6' to create a Pinterest-like flow where cards of varying heights stack neatly without unnecessary whitespace.

column2: Layered Z-Index Grid Composition in Tailwind
column10: Construct a visually deep UI section with [LAYER_COUNT] overlapping grid layers using Tailwind CSS. Use a single parent grid container where multiple child elements occupy the same grid-area. Apply different [TRANSLATE_VALUE] (using Tailwind's translate-x/y) and [OPACITY_SCALE] to each layer to create a parallax or 3D effect. Integrate fluid typography on the top-most layer to ensure the message is clear regardless of the background complexity.
column11: By assigning all children to 'grid-area: 1 / 1 / -1 / -1', the system creates a stack of layers where an 'opacity-50' decorative pattern sits behind a 'z-20' fluid heading.

column2: Micro-Typography and Kerning Utilities for Tailwind
column10: Extend the Tailwind CSS configuration to include advanced micro-typography settings. Define a custom set of [TRACKING_VALUES] for letter-spacing specifically designed for fluid typography scales. Include utilities for [FONT_SMOOTHING] (antialiased vs subpixel-antialiased) and show how to apply 'font-feature-settings' (like 'ss01', 'tnum') as arbitrary values or theme extensions. Explain how these enhancements improve the legibility of large fluid headers.
column11: The prompt configures 'tracking-tighter' to tighten as the fluid font size increases, preventing headlines from looking too loose on large screens.

column2: Grid Auto-Flow and Dense Packing Optimization
column10: Develop a Tailwind CSS grid that leverages 'grid-auto-flow: [FLOW_DIRECTION]' and 'dense' packing. Configure the grid to automatically generate columns of [AUTO_COL_SIZE] width. Items should have a minimum width of [MIN_ITEM_WIDTH]. Provide logic for occasional 'featured' items to span multiple rows/columns while the 'dense' property fills in the gaps. This layout is ideal for dynamic CMS content where item sizes are unpredictable.
column11: Using 'grid-flow-row-dense' and 'grid-cols-[repeat(auto-fill,minmax(200px,1fr))]', the grid automatically repositions smaller items to eliminate gaps left by 'col-span-2' blocks.

column2: Theme Extension for Global Fluid Spacing and Type
column10: As a Technical SEO and Frontend Lead, create a unified Tailwind CSS 'theme.extend' object that links spacing and typography to a shared fluid scale. Use [SPACING_BASE] as the foundation for padding/margin and [TYPE_BASE] for font sizes. Implement a [CLAMP_FORMULA] that ensures the entire site's rhythm scales proportionally with the viewport. Demonstrate the SEO benefits of this approach (CLV/Layout Shift optimization) and provide the implementation code.
column11: The configuration synchronizes 'p-fluid' and 'text-fluid' utilities, ensuring that as text grows, the surrounding white space expands at the same mathematical rate for perfect visual balance.

column2: Optimizing GitHub Actions for AWS ECS Fargate CI/CD Pipelines
column10: Act as a Senior DevOps Engineer. Design a high-performance GitHub Actions workflow for deploying a containerized application to AWS ECS Fargate. column11: A technical design doc for MongoDB where documents carry a '__v' schema version, and the CI/CD pipeline triggers a background Celery task to upgrade documents in batches.

column2: Security Hardening for Automated Migration Runners
column10: Database migrations often require elevated privileges. Create a security architecture for a [CI_CD_RUNNER_TYPE] that executes migrations. Use [SECRET_MANAGER] for dynamic credential injection. Define a 'Least Privilege' model for the migration user ([DB_PRIVILEGES]) ensuring it can alter schemas but cannot drop the entire database or access sensitive PII without an audit log. Describe how to rotate these credentials automatically after every migration job.
column11: A Vault-integrated CI/CD setup where temporary PostgreSQL roles are generated with short-lived 'ALTER' permissions and then immediately revoked upon job completion.

column2: Liquibase vs Flyway: Advanced CI/CD Integration Comparison
column10: As a consultant, provide a deep-dive comparison between Liquibase and Flyway for a team dealing with [CURRENT_PAIN_POINTS]. Evaluate their suitability for [TARGET_INFRASTRUCTURE]. Specifically, analyze how each tool handles 'out-of-order' migrations and 'checksum mismatches' in a multi-developer [CI_CD_TOOL] environment. Provide a recommendation based on a [TEAM_SKILLSET] (e.g., Java-heavy vs. SQL-heavy teams).
column11: A 10-page equivalent comparison document concluding that Liquibase's XML/YAML abstraction is superior for cross-DB support despite Flyway's simpler SQL-first approach.

column2: AI-Driven SQL Performance Impact Analysis in CI/CD
column10: Design a pipeline step that uses [LLM_MODEL] to analyze the 'EXPLAIN ANALYZE' output of a proposed migration. The script should intercept the SQL from a Pull Request, run it against a staging [DATABASE_ENGINE] instance, and feed the query plan to the AI. The AI must flag potential full table scans, high memory usage, or missing indexes. Integrate this as a 'Reviewer' comment in the Git repository, blocking the merge if the 'Cost' exceeds a certain threshold.
column11: A bridge script that sends Postgres Query Plans to GPT-4o, which then comments on the PR: 'Warning: This migration will cause a Seq Scan on a 10M row table.'

column2: Blue-Green Database Deployment Strategy for Statefull Workloads
column10: Design a Blue-Green deployment strategy for a [CLOUD_PLATFORM] database. Explain how to use [REPLICATION_METHOD] (e.g., Logical Replication) to keep a 'Green' (upgraded) instance in sync with the 'Blue' (production) instance. Detail the 'Switchover' logic: how to briefly pause writes, verify synchronization, and flip the DNS/Connection String. Include a 'Fail-Back' plan that uses [SYNC_TOOL] to reverse the replication if the Green instance fails post-launch.
column11: A Terraform and Bash orchestration plan for AWS RDS using Logical Replication slots to migrate from Postgres 12 to 15 with less than 30 seconds of downtime.

column2: Audit Logging and Compliance for Automated Schema Changes
column10: For an organization following [COMPLIANCE_STANDARD] (e.g., SOC2, HIPAA), design a tamper-proof audit trail for all automated database migrations. column11: A JSON-structured logging schema that records the 'WHO, WHAT, WHEN' of every DDL statement, stored in an immutable S3 bucket for compliance auditing.

column2: Automated Data Masking during Staging Database Migrations
column10: In the context of database migrations, detail a process for automatically refreshing a staging [DATABASE_ENGINE] environment with production data while masking [SENSITIVE_COLUMNS] using [MASKING_TOOL]. Ensure that the masking logic preserves data distribution and referential integrity so that the migration scripts are tested against realistic 'shapes' of data without exposing PII.

column2: Disaster Recovery Simulation for Database Migration Failures
column10: Develop a 'Game Day' simulation script for a [FAILURE_SCENARIO] during a database migration. The goal is to meet [RTO_RPO_TARGETS]. Provide a report template that summarizes the 'Mean Time To Recover' (MTTR) for the database layer.

column2: Stateful Rollback: Merging Delta Data after Migration Reverts
column10: One of the hardest problems in database rollbacks is 'New Data' created during the failed release. Design a strategy to capture data inserted into [DELTA_TABLES] during the [TIME_WINDOW] between the migration and the rollback. Detail the [CONFLICT_RESOLUTION_STRATEGY] to merge this delta back into the old schema structure once the rollback is complete.

column2: Automated Versioning for Snowflake/Data Warehouse Migrations
column10: Data warehouses like [DW_PLATFORM] have unique migration needs compared to OLTP. Design a CI/CD pipeline using [DBT_OR_TOOL] to manage 'Blue/Green' schema deployments for analytical models. column11: A custom GitHub Action that wraps SQL execution in a 'BEGIN; ... ROLLBACK;' block and extracts the 'pg_stat_statements' data to predict production impact.

column2: Optimizing DynamoDB Global Tables for Multi-Region Conflict Resolution
column10: Act as a Senior AWS Architect. Design a multi-region active-active NoSQL layer using DynamoDB Global Tables across [PRIMARY_REGIONS]. Include schema design patterns to minimize hot keys and explain the use of TTL for cross-region data lifecycle management.

column10: Provide a comprehensive technical guide for setting up an Amazon Aurora Global Database for a [DB_CLUSTER_SIZE] workload. Define the [HEALTH_CHECK_CRITERIA] to trigger automated regional failover. Explain how to use Route 53 Application Recovery Controller (ARC) to manage routing control states and ensure high availability during regional outages.

column10: Design a globally distributed [API_TYPE] using Amazon API Gateway and AWS Lambda. column11: By deploying regional API endpoints with a custom domain and latency routing, the system reduces overhead by 40%. The authorizer uses local DynamoDB caches to validate tokens without cross-region calls.

column10: Develop a security and encryption framework for a multi-region AWS environment. column2: The Event-Based Localized Pitch
column10: Focus on geographic influence. Pitch [BRAND_NAME] on a campaign centered around [LOCAL_EVENT] in [CITY_REGION]. Propose an [OFFLINE_TO_ONLINE_STRATEGY] (e.g., inviting followers to a store location or using a geo-tagged story) to drive physical foot traffic or localized digital sales.
column11: Subject: Exclusive [CITY_REGION] coverage for [BRAND_NAME] during [LOCAL_EVENT]. I am the go-to voice for [CITY_REGION], and I can drive significant local engagement for your brand during this peak event week.

column2: The Long-Term Brand Ambassador Pitch
column10: Instead of a one-off post, pitch a 6-month ambassadorship to [BRAND_NAME]. Outline a [SIX_MONTH_VISION] where you integrate the brand into your lifestyle consistently. List [MONTHLY_DELIVERABLES] and explain the [LOYALTY_BENEFIT]—how seeing a creator use a product repeatedly builds significantly more trust than a single ad.
column11: Subject: Proposal for a Long-term Partnership: [YOUR_NAME] x [BRAND_NAME]. One-off posts are noisy; let’s build a lasting narrative that turns my audience into your loyal customers over the next six months.

column2: The UGC (User Generated Content) Focused Pitch
column10: Pitch your skills as a content creator first and an influencer second. Tell [BRAND_NAME] you will provide [CONTENT_VOLUME] of high-quality videos for them to use in their own paid ads. Include [USAGE_RIGHTS] in the deal and explain how this increases their [AD_SPEND_EFFICIENCY] by providing authentic, high-converting creative assets.
column11: Subject: High-converting UGC for [BRAND_NAME]’s ad accounts. I specialize in creating authentic content that lowers CPAs—let me build a library of assets for your marketing team.

column2: The 'Unboxing and First Impression' Specialist Pitch
column10: Focus on the visual and sensory experience of a product. Pitch [BRAND_NAME] on a high-aesthetic unboxing video. Reference their [PACKAGING_STRENGTH] and how your [AESTHETIC_STYLE] will highlight it. Explain that your [AUDIENCE_CURIOSITY] is highest during discovery phases, making first-impression videos highly effective.
column11: Subject: Showcasing the [BRAND_NAME] experience: Unboxing & First Impressions. Your brand’s aesthetic perfectly matches my feed, and my followers love the 'ASMR' and visual satisfaction of my discovery videos.

column2: The Direct Comparison/Alternative Pitch
column10: Position [BRAND_NAME] as the smarter choice for a [TARGET_CONSUMER_TYPE]. Contrast them with the [MARKET_LEADER] and focus on a [SUPERIOR_FEATURE]. Pitch a 'Why I Switched' or 'The Honest Truth' style content piece that feels objective but heavily favors the sponsor.
column11: Subject: Why [BRAND_NAME] is the better choice for [TARGET_CONSUMER_TYPE]. I want to show my audience why I’ve moved away from [MARKET_LEADER] and why your [SUPERIOR_FEATURE] is the real game-changer.

column2: The Retargeting/Follow-up Pitch (The 'Bump')
column10: This is a follow-up for a previous pitch that went unanswered. Mention a [NEW_MILESTONE] (e.g., hitting 10k followers) or a [RECENT_VIRAL_POST] that proves your current momentum. Present a [REFINED_OFFER] that is even more compelling than the first, reminding [BRAND_NAME] of the value you bring.
column11: Subject: Checking in + New Milestone: 1M Views this month. I wanted to bump my previous proposal for [BRAND_NAME] with some fresh data from a recent viral campaign I just wrapped.

column2: The 'Ethical/Sustainable' Values Pitch
column10: For brands with a mission. Focus on [SPECIFIC_VALUE] (e.g., sustainability, cruelty-free, fair trade). Explain that your audience has a high [AUDIENCE_DEMAND] for ethical products. Pitch a [STORYTELLING_ANGLE] that goes beyond the product and highlights the brand's mission, creating a deep emotional connection.
column11: Subject: Sharing [BRAND_NAME]’s mission with a conscious audience. My followers don’t just buy products; they buy values. Let’s tell the story of your commitment to [SPECIFIC_VALUE] together.

column2: Onboarding Email Sequence for SaaS Product Adoption
column10: Act as a lifecycle marketing strategist. Create a 5-part email onboarding sequence for [PRODUCT_NAME] designed to maximize retention by driving users toward [USER_MILESTONE_1]. Focus on [CORE_BENEFIT]. The sequence must cover: 1. Welcome & Quick Win, 2. Overcoming Friction, 3. Social Proof/Case Study, 4. Advanced Feature Highlight, 5. Trial Ending [TRIAL_LENGTH] countdown. Use a helpful, authoritative tone.
column11: The sequence includes a Day 1 'Welcome' email focusing on setting up the first project and a Day 4 'Deep Dive' email showcasing how to automate reports to save 5 hours weekly.

column2: Behavioral Trigger Emails for Inactive Subscribers
column10: Develop a 3-email 'Win-Back' sequence triggered after [INACTIVITY_THRESHOLD] of no opens/clicks. Use psychological principles like the 'Zeigarnik Effect' and scarcity. Email 1: 'We missed you' with [PRIMARY_VALUE_PROP]. Email 2: Highlight [LATEST_FEATURE] they haven't seen. Email 3: Final call to stay on the list or be removed. Focus on list hygiene and re-igniting interest.
column11: The sequence starts with a lighthearted 'Is everything okay?' subject line and transitions into a high-value summary of the most popular content missed during their absence.

column2: Educational Drip Sequence for Thought Leadership
column10: Draft a 7-day 'Email Course' style sequence focused on [NICHE_TOPIC] for [TARGET_AUDIENCE]. Each email must solve a specific sub-problem. Day 3 must debunk [COMMON_MYTH]. The goal is to establish authority and keep subscribers opening daily. Include curiosity-gap subject lines and a CTA for a deep-dive consultation at the end.
column11: This 7-day 'Mastering Technical SEO' course delivers daily 2-minute hacks, culminating in a comprehensive site audit checklist that boosts open rates to over 45%.

column2: Post-Purchase Retention Sequence for E-commerce
column10: Design a 4-part post-purchase sequence for customers who bought [PRODUCT_CATEGORY]. Email 1: Immediate thank you and shipping expectations. Email 2: Usage tips/How-to guide to reduce returns. Email 3: Request for UGC/Review. Email 4: Personalized recommendation for [UPSELL_PRODUCT] based on their purchase. Maintain a [BRAND_VOICE] tone throughout.
column11: The flow automates a 'How to style your boots' guide 3 days after delivery, followed by a 15% discount on matching leather care kits 10 days later.

column2: Milestone Celebration Sequence for Gamified Retention
column10: Generate a template for a 'Milestone Achievement' email when a user hits [USER_ACHIEVEMENT]. Use celebratory language and include a [REWARD_TYPE]. Integrate a social sharing component to invite others to [COMMUNITY_NAME]. The goal is to reinforce positive behavior and increase the 'stickiness' of the platform.
column11: The output provides a vibrant 'Level Up' email congratulating the user on their 30-day streak and offering a 'Power User' badge they can share on LinkedIn.

column2: The 'Value-Loop' Newsletter Structure for High Retention
column10: Create a recurring weekly newsletter framework for the [INDUSTRY] sector. Divide the email into 4 sections: 1. The 'Big Idea' (tackling [READER_PAIN_POINT]), 2. Curated 'Quick Hits' from [CONTENT_PILLARS], 3. Community Shoutout/Member Spotlight, and 4. The 'Actionable Homework' for the week. Focus on low-friction consumption and high utility.
column11: A 'FinTech Friday' template that summarizes market shifts, spotlights a 'Budgeter of the Week,' and provides one specific task to optimize a savings account.

column2: Feedback-Driven Retention Sequence (VOC)
column10: Construct a 2-email sequence requesting feedback on [SERVICE_NAME]. Use the 'Micro-Survey' technique where the first question is embedded in the email. Offer [INCENTIVE] for completion. Email 1: The 'Why your opinion matters' ask. Email 2: Follow-up emphasizing that the [SURVEY_LINK] is closing soon. Use psychological triggers of reciprocity and importance.
column11: The emails feature a single-click rating system that directs users to a tailored feedback form, resulting in a 20% increase in customer insights.

column2: VIP/Loyalty Tier Invitation Sequence
column10: Write a 3-email sequence inviting top-tier users (those meeting [VIP_CRITERIA]) into an exclusive inner circle. Highlight the [EXCLUSIVE_BENEFIT]. Use language that emphasizes exclusivity, belonging, and recognition. The goal is to reduce churn among the most profitable [BRAND_NAME] customers.
column11: This campaign targets users who spent over $500, offering them 'Founding Member' status and early access to all future product launches.

column2: Pre-emptive Churn Prevention Sequence
column10: Create a 3-part sequence triggered when [USAGE_DROP_METRIC] occurs. Email 1: A 'personal' check-in from a founder or account manager. Email 2: A curated list of resources or 'Did you know?' tips. Email 3: A [RECOVERY_OFFER] or an invitation to a 1-on-1 call with [SUPPORT_CONTACT]. Focus on empathy and removing blockers.
column11: The sequence triggers when a user hasn't logged in for 10 days, offering a personalized 5-minute training video to solve common hurdles.

column2: Referral Loop Integration for Audience Growth
column10: Design an email sequence to turn active subscribers into advocates. Email 1: Announcing [REFERRAL_PROGRAM_NAME] and the [REFERRER_REWARD]. Email 2: Social proof of others winning rewards. Email 3: Monthly referral status update. Ensure the instructions are incredibly simple and the value for both parties ([REFERRER_REWARD] and [REFEREE_REWARD]) is clear.
column11: A 'Share the Love' email that gives users a unique link to earn a free month of service for every friend they refer who signs up.

column2: The 'Flash Value' Sequence for Low Open Rates
column10: Create a high-urgency 3-day sequence to boost engagement. Day 1: A massive revelation about [CORE_PROBLEM]. Day 2: A [QUICK_FIX_TOOL] provided for free. Day 3: A 'Last chance' to access a limited-time resource. Use aggressive, curiosity-driven subject lines and short, punchy copy to reset the subscriber's habit of opening your emails.
column11: This 'engagement burst' uses subject lines like 'The $10k mistake you're making' to achieve record-high open rates during a slow month.

column2: Seasonal/Holiday Retention Nurture
column10: Draft a 4-email sequence themed around [HOLIDAY_SEASON]. Instead of a pure sales pitch, focus on solving [SEASONAL_PAIN_POINT]. Integrate [PROMOTION] as a secondary solution. Email 1: Helpful advice. Email 2: Curated gift/resource guide. Email 3: The 'Holiday Survival' kit (Product mention). Email 4: Last-minute value. Maintain a festive but professional tone.
column11: The 'Tax Season Sanity' sequence provides free expense templates in March before introducing a discount on accounting software in April.

column2: Product Update & Feature Adoption Flow
column10: Write a sequence announcing [NEW_FEATURE]. Instead of listing features, focus on how it solves [PAIN_RESOLVED]. Email 1: The 'Why' behind the update. Email 2: A walkthrough using [DEMO_VIDEO_URL]. Email 3: A 'Success Story' of a beta tester. Goal: Drive feature adoption to increase overall product stickiness.
column11: A 'Say Goodbye to Manual Entry' announcement that walks users through the new OCR tool with a 60-second Loom video demo.

column2: The 'Ask Me Anything' Interactive Sequence
column10: Develop a 3-part interactive sequence. Email 1: Announcing an AMA with [EXPERT_NAME] regarding [TOPIC_AREA]. Email 2: 'Last call' for questions by [SUBMISSION_DEADLINE]. Email 3: The 'Answers' email (or link to the recording). This sequence builds deep community engagement and reinforces the value of being on the list.
column11: This interactive flow encourages subscribers to hit 'Reply,' which improves sender reputation while providing a wealth of user-generated content.

column2: Webinar-to-Retention Bridge Sequence
column10: Create a 5-email post-webinar sequence. Email 1: Replay link and [KEY_TAKEAWAY] summary. Email 2: Answering 'The questions we didn't get to.' Email 3: Deep dive into a specific sub-topic of [WEBINAR_TOPIC]. Email 4: Introduction to the [NEXT_STEP_OFFER]. Email 5: Final scarcity-based call to action. Focus on extending the 'educational high' of the webinar.
column11: The sequence bridges the gap between a free 'Content Strategy' webinar and a paid coaching program by providing three additional 'bonus' worksheets.

column2: Preference Center Update Campaign
column10: Draft a self-segmentation email sequence. Ask users if [CURRENT_FREQUENCY] is too much and invite them to choose [CONTENT_CATEGORIES] they care about. Use [BRAND_VOICE] to explain that you only want to send what is useful. This reduces unsubscribes by giving the user control over their inbox experience.
column11: Subject: 'Less is more (if you want it to be),' allowing users to opt into 'Weekly Summaries' instead of 'Daily Alerts' with one click.

column2: The 'Year in Review' Personalized Retention Email
column10: Design a highly personalized 'Year in Review' email template. Include placeholders for [USER_DATA_POINTS] (e.g., time saved, tasks completed). Highlight [COMMUNITY_MILESTONES] and conclude with [NEXT_YEAR_VISION]. The goal is to remind the user of the cumulative value they've received over the past 12 months.
column11: A Spotify-wrapped style email for a fitness app that visualizes the user's total calories burned and most-played workout tracks of the year.

column2: Expert Interview Series Drip Sequence
column10: Create a 3-email sequence promoting and delivering an exclusive interview with [GUEST_NAME]. Email 1: Teaser highlighting [GUEST_EXPERTISE]. Email 2: The [BIG_REVEAL] snippet from the interview. Email 3: Full access link + a 'Summary of Action Steps.' Use the authority of the guest to boost the perceived value of your newsletter.
column11: The sequence builds hype for an interview with a top VC, providing subscribers with an exclusive 'Investment Checklist' shared during the talk.

column2: Case Study 'Success Path' Retention Sequence
column10: Develop a narrative-driven sequence featuring [SUCCESSFUL_USER_NAME]. Email 1: The 'Before' (pain and struggle). Email 2: The 'Aha!' moment and the [STRATEGY_USED]. Email 3: The 'After' featuring [RESULTS_ACHIEVED]. Close with an invitation for the reader to achieve similar results using your product/service.
column11: A three-part story about how a small agency used the 'Inbox Zero' method to regain 10 hours a week, prompting readers to try the same workflow.

column2: The 'Unsubscribe Page' Save Sequence
column10: Create the copy for an 'Unsubscribe' landing page and a follow-up 'Confirmation' email. On the page, offer a [DOWNSELL_OPTION] (e.g., 'Once a month only'). If they still leave, send a final 'Good-bye' email featuring [SAD_MASCOT_NAME] and a link to a 'Best of' resource they can keep. Focus on leaving a lasting positive impression.
column11: The 'Wait! Don't go' page offers a 'Snooze for 30 days' option, which successfully retains 15% of users who initially intended to unsubscribe.

column2: High-Conversion SaaS Hook and Pain Point Storyboard
column10: Act as a senior creative director. Storyboard a 15-second fast-paced [PLATFORM] video for [PRODUCT_NAME]. Focus the first 3 seconds on a high-intensity visual representation of [CORE_PAIN_POINT] for [TARGET_AUDIENCE]. Include precise shot descriptions (MS, CU, ECU), rapid-fire transition cues (glitch, whip-pan), and on-screen text overlays. Format as a table with columns: Time, Visual, Audio/VO, and Text Overlay. Ensure the pacing matches a 128 BPM track.
column11: The storyboard opens with a 0.5s ECU of a stressed user clicking a mouse rapidly, followed by a whip-pan to a cluttered dashboard to visualize the pain of data overload.

column2: The 'One-Feature Wonder' Rapid Feature Showcase
column10: Generate a storyboard for a 30-second 'deep dive' short-form video. The focus is exclusively on [KILLER_FEATURE] of [PRODUCT_NAME]. Use a [UI_STYLE] aesthetic for the UI walkthrough. The narrative must follow the 'Feature-Benefit-Result' loop three times in rapid succession (max 4 seconds per loop). Specify camera movements like 'digital zoom-in' on UI elements and 'speed ramps' for transitions. Include sound design cues like 'interface clicks' and 'success chimes'.
column11: The video uses 2-second speed ramps to transition between the 'Automation' setup and the 'Instant Report' output, highlighting the 90% time-saving benefit.

column2: Split-Screen SaaS Comparison: Manual vs. Automated
column10: Create a storyboard for a split-screen vertical video comparing [MANUAL_PROCESS] (left side, grayscale) vs. [PRODUCT_NAME]'s [AUTOMATED_WORKFLOW] (right side, vibrant colors). Pacing should be chaotic on the left and serene/fast on the right. The video ends with the screens merging into a [TIME_SAVED] statistics overlay. Detail the specific UI actions to be shown on each side to maximize the contrast in efficiency.
column11: Frame 1 shows a split screen where the left side is a frantic time-lapse of spreadsheet entry while the right side shows a single click in the app resulting in an instant data sync.

column2: Social Proof and User Success Micro-Testimonial
column10: Storyboard a 20-second social-proof-led video. Start with a fast-cut montage of 5 different [USER_PERSONA] faces. Transition into a screen recording of [PRODUCT_NAME] achieving [KEY_OUTCOME]. Include a 'floating notification' style UI for the [TRUST_SIGNAL] (e.g., G2 badges, 5-star reviews). Provide specific instructions for 'Match Cuts' between different users' reactions and the software's success states.
column11: The storyboard specifies a match-cut where a user's 'wow' expression perfectly aligns with a 'Data Processed' checkmark appearing in the UI.

column2: The 'Anti-SaaS' Disruptive Narrative Storyboard
column10: Design a storyboard that mocks [INDUSTRY_CLICHE] and positions [PRODUCT_NAME] as the radical alternative. Use a [BRAND_VOICE] tone. The visual style should be 'Lo-Fi'/User-Generated Content (UGC) mixed with high-end 2D motion graphics. Focus on a fast-paced 'Problem-Agitate-Solve' structure. Specify where to use 'Green Screen' effects to place the speaker inside the software interface.
column11: A 15-second storyboard that opens with a handheld 'phone-style' shot of someone deleting a legacy software icon, followed by a fast-paced kinetic typography sequence explaining the disruption.

column2: Interactive 'Choose Your Adventure' SaaS Storyboard
column10: Develop a storyboard for a video designed for [PLATFORM_FEATURES] (like Instagram Stories or TikTok interactive elements). The video asks the user to choose between [USER_PATH_A] or [USER_PATH_B]. Create two distinct 5-second branches and a unified 5-second closing CTA for [PRODUCT_NAME]. Outline the visual cues for the 'tap here' stickers and how the UI shifts based on the imaginary choice.
column11: The storyboard defines a 3-second 'loop' where the screen is split into two clickable zones, each triggering a different feature-reveal animation for the SaaS product.

column2: Technical 'How-It-Works' for Non-Technical Founders
column10: Construct a storyboard for a 45-second video explaining the [COMPLEX_ENGINE] of [PRODUCT_NAME] using a [SIMPLIFIED_ANALOGY]. Use 'Explainer' style motion graphics overlaid on real UI footage. The pacing should be 'Snap-Cut' (cuts every 1-1.5 seconds). Ensure the [USER_ACTION] is the central focus of the final 10 seconds. Detail the transition from a 3D abstract object (the analogy) into the 2D software interface.
column11: A 45-second storyboard transitioning from an animation of a sorting machine to the SaaS app's automated tagging interface to simplify the concept of ML data processing.

column2: Kinetic Typography 'Statement' Video for SaaS Brand
column10: Create a high-energy kinetic typography storyboard for [PRODUCT_NAME]. No live-action footage; only text, [BRAND_COLORS], and UI silhouettes. The script should center on [CORE_MISSION]. Map out the font weight changes, rotation, and scale-up animations to match a heavy-bass synth track. End with a massive, screen-filling [CTA_TEXT].
column11: The word 'Speed' expands to fill the screen in brand-specific neon blue, pulsing to the beat before shattering into the app's dashboard view.

column2: Mobile-First 'Day in the Life' Productivity Storyboard
column10: Draft a storyboard for a 15-second 'Productivity Hack' video. Show a user performing [DAILY_TASK] at [TIME_OF_DAY] using [PRODUCT_NAME]. Focus on the [EMOTION] of the user. Use a mix of 'POV' (Point of View) shots of a mobile device and 'Over-the-shoulder' shots. Pacing should start slow and accelerate as the task is completed instantly. Include 'Sound-On' cues for haptic feedback sounds.
column11: Shot 1 shows a POV of a user in a coffee shop at 8 AM, with a 3-second speed-up of them resolving a ticket in the SaaS app with a single swipe.

column2: The 'Integration Ecosystem' Web-of-Apps Storyboard
column10: Design a storyboard showcasing [PRODUCT_NAME] as the hub for [INTEGRATION_1], [INTEGRATION_2], and [INTEGRATION_3]. Use a 'Connecting-the-Dots' visual metaphor. The camera should zoom through 3D 'Windows' of each integrated app, showing data flowing into [PRODUCT_NAME]. Focus on 'Smooth-Motion' transitions and 'Data-Stream' particles. End with a consolidated dashboard view.
column11: The camera flies through a Slack notification icon, into a Salesforce record, and finally lands on the SaaS dashboard where all data points merge into a single chart.

column2: AI Feature 'Magic Moment' Reveal Storyboard
column10: Storyboard a 10-second 'Magic Moment' for [PRODUCT_NAME]'s [AI_FEATURE]. The video should show a user inputting [INPUT_DATA] and the AI generating [OUTPUT_RESULT] in real-time. Use a 'Shimmer' or 'Glow' effect in the storyboard to denote AI activity. The transition should be a 'Dissolve-to-Done' effect. Focus on the speed and accuracy of the transformation.
column11: A tight shot of a cursor clicking 'Generate', followed by a 1.5-second shimmer effect where messy text instantly transforms into a structured project plan.

column2: SaaS ROI: 'The Number That Matters' Storyboard
column10: Create a storyboard for a data-driven short-form ad. The hero of the video is the number '[PERCENTAGE_INCREASE]'. Start with a boring 2D chart, then have [PRODUCT_NAME] 'break' the chart to show the new growth. Use '3D Extrusion' effects for the numbers. Include a VO script that emphasizes the [DOLLAR_VALUE] saved/earned. Pacing must be 'Staccato' (short, sharp movements).
column11: The storyboard depicts a standard line graph that suddenly bends upward at a 90-degree angle, with the number '+45%' bursting through the UI in bold 3D text.

column2: Onboarding 'First 60 Seconds' Blitz Storyboard
column10: Storyboard a 20-second 'Fastest Onboarding' video. Frame 1: [SIGNUP_ACTION]. Frame 2: [SET_UP_STEP]. Frame 3: [AHA_MOMENT]. Use 'Hyper-lapse' editing techniques. Specify visual 'Callouts' (circles and arrows) that appear in sync with a fast-paced drum track. The goal is to prove the product is 'Zero-Config' or 'Instant-Setup'.
column11: A 20-second hyper-lapse showing a user clicking 'Sign up with Google' and immediately landing on a fully populated analytics dashboard within 5 seconds.

column2: The 'Dark Mode' Aesthetic Feature Teaser
column10: Develop a storyboard for a high-end, 'Apple-style' product teaser for [PRODUCT_NAME]. Use a 'Dark Mode' UI with [BRAND_ACCENT_COLOR] highlights. Lighting should be 'Cinematic-Low-Key'. Focus on macro shots of UI elements (buttons, toggles, gradients). No voiceover, only a sophisticated 'Tech-Ambient' track. End with the logo reveal and [TARGET_NICHE] tag-line.
column11: Slow-motion close-ups of sleek neon-lit buttons being toggled, culminating in a wide shot of the dark-themed dashboard glowing in a black environment.

column2: User Journey: From Chaos to Calm Storyboard
column10: Storyboard a 30-second narrative arc. The first 10 seconds show [CHAOTIC_SCENE] (fast cuts, shaky cam, discordant noise). The [KEY_TRANSITION_ELEMENT] (a specific button click in [PRODUCT_NAME]) triggers an instant shift to [CALM_SCENE] (smooth camera, slow motion, lo-fi beats). Detail the color grading shift from desaturated/cold to warm/vibrant.
column11: The chaos of 50 open browser tabs disappears with one click on the 'Sync' button, transitioning to a clean, single-window view with soft blue lighting.

column2: SaaS Collaboration: 'The Global Team' Storyboard
column10: Create a storyboard showing [PRODUCT_NAME] facilitating [COLLAB_ACTION] across borders. Use a 'Zoom-Out-to-Globe' transition. Frame 1: [TEAM_MEMBER_1_LOC] (Morning). Frame 2: [TEAM_MEMBER_2_LOC] (Night). Show the real-time cursor movement or 'live edit' feature of the SaaS. Pacing should be 'Flow-State' (continuous, sliding transitions).
column11: A split screen showing a developer in London and a designer in Tokyo both interacting with the same live project file, their cursors dancing in perfect sync.

column2: Gamified SaaS Feature Highlight Storyboard
column10: Storyboard a 15-second video that treats [FEATURE_TO_GAMIFY] like a video game. Use 8-bit sound effects and 'Level Up' UI overlays. When the user completes the action in [PRODUCT_NAME], a [REWARD_VISUAL] (like a trophy or coins) appears. Include 'Progress Bar' animations at the bottom of the screen that fill up as the video progresses.
column11: The user drags a task to 'Done', triggering a pixel-art 'Level Up' notification and a shower of gold coins over the SaaS dashboard.

column2: The 'Hidden Easter Egg' Discovery Storyboard
column10: Design a storyboard for a 'Pro-Tip' style video. Show a 'hidden' or underutilized [SECRET_SHORTCUT] in [PRODUCT_NAME]. Use a 'Screen-within-a-Screen' layout. The main screen is a 'How-to' and the corner screen is a [USER_REACTION] (shock/joy). End with a call to 'Comment "SECRET" for more tips'. Focus on 'Stop-Motion' style UI reveals.
column11: A fast-paced reveal of a keyboard shortcut that automates reports, paired with a small window showing a creator's mind-blown reaction.

column2: SaaS Security & Trust 'Vault' Storyboard
column10: Develop a storyboard focusing on security for [PRODUCT_NAME]. Visualize [SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE] being 'locked' behind a [SECURITY_FEATURE]. Use 'Vault-Door' sound effects and 'Cyber-Grid' overlays. The aesthetic should be high-tech and reassuring. Close with 3 rapid-fire [TRUST_BADGE] icons appearing on screen with 'thud' sound effects.
column11: Digital files transform into golden blocks and slide into a futuristic vault labeled with the SaaS logo, followed by a 'SOC2 Certified' badge slamming onto the screen.

column2: Seasonal/Holiday Promo 'SaaS Gift' Storyboard
column10: Storyboard a 15-second seasonal ad for [PRODUCT_NAME]. Incorporate [SEASON_HOLIDAY] themes (visuals and music). Show the software interface having [SEASONAL_UI_ELEMENT]. The core message is the [PROMO_OFFER]. Transitions should be 'Thematic' (e.g., snow falling to clear the screen, or a gift box opening to reveal the UI).
column11: A digital gift box unwraps to reveal the [PRODUCT_NAME] dashboard covered in subtle festive lights, highlighting a '50% Off' discount code.

column2: Cyberpunk Katana Duel Slow-Motion Prompt
column10: Cinematic 8k video, ultra-slow motion at 120fps. A [CHARACTER_DESCRIPTION] performs a lethal strike in a [ENVIRONMENT]. The [BLADE_COLOR] katana cuts through the air, creating visible pressure waves. [LIGHTING_STYLE] illumination with high-contrast shadows. Anamorphic lens flares, particles of dust suspended in time, motion blur reduction, hyper-realistic textures.
column11: A neon-enhanced cyborg slices through a rain-drenched alleyway in 120fps, showing individual water droplets vibrating off the glowing blue blade.

column2: Macro Fluid Dynamics and Splash Slow-Mo
column10: High-speed macro cinematography, 240fps slow-motion. A [LIQUID_TYPE] collides with [OBJECT_OF_IMPACT] in a [COLOR_PALETTE] color space. Studio lighting, softbox diffusion. Against a [BACKGROUND] backdrop. Focus on surface tension, crown splashes, and micro-droplet formation. Photorealistic, 8k resolution, extreme detail.
column11: Vibrant gold liquid hits a spinning gear at 240fps, creating a perfect crown-shaped splash with individual droplets suspended against a deep obsidian background.

column2: Urban Drifting Vehicle Slow-Motion Sequence
column10: Low-angle tracking shot, slow-motion action. A [VEHICLE_MODEL] drifts around a sharp corner in [CITY_SETTING] during [TIME_OF_DAY]. Hyper-detailed [SMOKE_COLOR] tire smoke billowing in slow waves. 35mm lens, cinematic grain, motion bucket 128. Sparks flying from the chassis hitting the asphalt, reflecting street lights.
column11: A matte black sports car slides through a Tokyo intersection at dusk, with thick purple tire smoke swirling slowly around the glowing taillights.

column2: Hyper-Realistic Pyrotechnic Explosion Slow-Mo
column10: Cinematic destruction sequence, 1000fps simulation style. A [EXPLODING_OBJECT] erupts from within. Fireballs blooming in slow motion with [CORE_TEMPERATURE_COLOR] centers. [DEBRIS_TYPE] shards flying toward the camera. [ATMOSPHERE] environment with heavy volumetric lighting. High dynamic range, embers floating, shockwave distortion.
column11: A vintage safe shatters from a localized blast, sending heavy iron shards and burning banknotes drifting through a smoke-filled vault in extreme slow motion.

column2: Fantasy Spellcasting Elemental Slow-Motion
column10: Epic fantasy action, slow-motion 60fps. A [MAGE_TYPE] executes a [CASTING_GESTURE]. [ELEMENT] begins to manifest around their hands, swirling in a [ENERGY_COLOR] vortex. Particles of light gathering in mid-air. Depth of field with blurred foreground. Ethereal glow, high-fidelity textures, magical realism.
